content: I've tried using a Raspberry Pi, Arduino Uno, and Arduino Mega to drive my 32x32 RGB LED Matrix from Adafruit, but was unhappy with the color depth and frame rate.  The Teensy v3.1 has a higher clock speed and supports DMA, which the SmartMatrix library uses to drive it at 24-bit color and much higher FPS.  This was my first attempt (back in April), and later replaced the bread board and jumper wires with a SmartMatrix Shield.

media.description: Sprites ripped from Tiny Barbarian DX (http://tinybarbarian.com) displayed on a 32x32 RGB LED Matrix from adafruit (http://www.adafruit.com/products/1484) ru...
